title: String to DateTime Conversion
description:
FSTRING_TO_DT convert a formatted string to a DATETIME value. Useing
the string FMT a format is given for decoding. The character '#' followed
by a letter defnes the information to be decoded.
#Y Year in the spelling in 08 or 2008
#M Month in the spelling of 01 or 1
#N Month in the spelling of 'Jan' or 'January' (Big and small letters are ignored)
#D Day in the spelling of 01 or 1
#h Hour in the spelling of 01 or 1
#m Minute in the spelling of 01 or 1
#s Second in the spelling of 01 or 1
name: FSTRING_TO_DT

input.name: SDT
input.description: Input variable for the source data text which contains the date and time as a string.

input.name: FMT
input.description: Input variable for the format that specifies how to interpret the source data text.

output.name: FSTRING_TO_DT
output.description: The resulting DateTime value extracted from the provided string based on the specified format.

return_value.description: The return value is the DateTime constructed from the parsed string.
